channel.title: Having trouble with making a webclient
channel.description:
can someone please help me make a webclient. I am trying to put the html code into webs.com and the client loads and then says Error click for details in red letters in the upper left corner and the client is all white. So i click it and it says "classnotfoundexception" then under that it says client.class. here is my code: [code]<HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE>Derek Scape</TITLE> <META HTTP-EQUIV="PRAGMA" CONTENT="NO-CACHE"> </HEAD>
<BODY>
<applet name="Derek Scape" width="765" height="503" archive="https://www.dropbox.com/s/oj616rba6f9ecdh/client.jar" code="client.class"> <param name="java_arguments" value="-Xmx1024m"> </applet>
</BODY> </HTML> [/code]

item.title: Having trouble with making a webclient
item.dc:creator: @Learning_Code Learning Code
item.description:
@Learning_Code wrote:

When you Jarred it, did you only jar .class files or the whole thing?

Read full topic

item.source: Having trouble with making a webclient

item.title: Having trouble with making a webclient
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

sorry that this is so long but I hope it helps

I had the same problem!! what I did was took the cache folder out put it onto my desktop, made a new folder called cache copied and pasted the files. Then I made it a .zip file uploaded it to dropbox.com got the link went into cachedownloader.java and changed the version to 0 and the one that says change this one to…

private final int VERSION = 0; // Version of cache //private String cacheLink = "http://hybridpvp.net/cache.zip"; // Link to cache private String cacheLink = "CHANGE THIS ONE TO YOUR LINK "; // Link to cache

Also, I went into signlink.java and searched for C:/

This is what it was before (EXAMPLE)

public static String findcachedir() { String as[] = {"C:/hybridpvpnetcache"};

I changed to this

public static String findcachedir() { String as[] = {"C:/"};

underneath it had something like this

I changed to my server/client name

Also this one

Before

public static String sencondDir() { File file = new File("./");

Changed

public static String sencondDir() { File file = new File("C:/");

After that I re-jarred the client but before I signed it I ran it to make sure that it ran properly and then uploaded the client/webclient.jar file to dropbox got the link and used it in this hmtl code

[code]

CLIENT NAME [/code]

Depending on the revision you have the manifest may need to be set to something else… I have skype also Oceannomic.

Read full topic
item.source: Having trouble with making a webclient
